dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Forty-one billion dollars in debt already, and they want a bailout? That's a little hard to swallow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forty-one billion dollars in debt already, and they want a bailout? That's a little hard to swallow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government should provide sufficient liquidity to keep Boeing going, Robert Stallard, an analyst with Vertical Research Partners, said in a client note, but with total debt of $41 billion already, more loans will bring serious risks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And that's on top of the 60.5 billion they're asking for. I mean, Boeing's argument is that this isn't just about them—it's about the whole aerospace supply chain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And that's on top of the sixty point five billion they're asking for. I mean, Boeing's argument is that this isn't just about them-it's about the whole aerospace supply chain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The statement didnt specify how much of the $60 billion the company believes it needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But didn't they burn through billions just producing those 400 MAX planes that are just sitting there? Like, that's a huge cash drain even before the pandemic hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But didn't they burn through billions just producing those four hundred M A X planes that are just sitting there? Like, that's a huge cash drain even before the pandemic hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing burned through billions in cash as it produced roughly 400 models of the plane that it has been unable to deliver to customers due to the planes grounding by global regulators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And now with airlines parking planes and delaying maintenance, it's a double whammy for their suppliers too. Aftermarket sales are tanking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And now with airlines parking planes and delaying maintenance, it's a double whammy for their suppliers too. Aftermarket sales are tanking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Parts manufacturers also face the prospect of a sharp slowdown in aftermarket sales with airlines parking planes and deferring maintenance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Trump's out here saying, "We have to protect Boeing." I get it, but after those two fatal crashes, public trust is already so low.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Trump's out here saying, We have to protect Boeing. I get it, but after those two fatal crashes, public trust is already so low.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the day, President Trump said at a press conference that support would be forthcoming. I think we have to protect Boeing, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Not to mention the stock buybacks. They spent what, billions enriching shareholders over the past decade, and now they want taxpayer money?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not to mention the stock buybacks. They spent what, billions enriching shareholders over the past decade, and now they want taxpayer money?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Critics of the prospect of so much taxpayer money going to Boeing and the airlines have focused on the billions of dollars worth of share buybacks that they have made over the past decade, enriching executives and their shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Sara Nelson from the Flight Attendants union called that out—said airlines shouldn't get off easy like the banks did in '08.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Sara Nelson from the Flight Attendants union called that out-said airlines shouldn't get off easy like the banks did in 'eight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sara Nelson, the president of the Association of Flight Attendants-CWA, vowed Monday that airlines wouldnt make out as easy as the banks did in 2008.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: She wants conditions—no bonuses, no buybacks, protect workers. Honestly, that feels fair if public money's involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She wants conditions-no bonuses, no buybacks, protect workers. Honestly, that feels fair if public money's involved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It means no bonuses, no buybacks, & no breaking union contracts in bankruptcy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Boeing's saying the long-term outlook is strong… once passenger traffic returns. It's just this cash flow nightmare right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Boeing's saying the long-term outlook is strong... once passenger traffic returns. It's just this cash flow nightmare right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The long term outlook for the industry is still strong, but until global passenger traffic resumes to normal levels, these measures are needed to manage the pressure on the aviation sector and the economy as a whole, Boeing said in the statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: S&P downgraded their debt, though. They're expecting an 11 to 12 billion dollar cash outflow this year. That's brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: S&P downgraded their debt, though. They're expecting an eleven to twelve billion dollar cash outflow this year. That's brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ratings agency now expects an outflow of $11 billion to $12 billion this year, down from a prior expectation of positive cash flow of $2 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So do we bail them out to save 2.5 million jobs, or do we let them figure it out and risk a collapse?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So do we bail them out to save two point five million jobs, or do we let them figure it out and risk a collapse?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing stands at the apex of a pyramid of 17,000 aerospace firms that employ 2.5 million workers while U.S. airlines directly employ 75o,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I think some help is inevitable, but it can't be a blank check. Dividend suspensions, wage floors, worker reps on the board—maybe that's the compromise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think some help is inevitable, but it can't be a blank check. Dividend suspensions, wage floors, worker reps on the board-maybe that's the compromise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Suspension of Boeings continued dividends to its shareholders could be one. Companies should commit to pay a min $15 wage and board seats for workers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still feels weird propping up a company that was already in crisis mode, pandemic or not.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still feels weird propping up a company that was already in crisis mode, pandemic or not.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. The optics are terrible. But the alternative might be worse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. The optics are terrible. But the alternative might be worse.
